Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Ignition \Ig*ni"tion\, n. [Cf. F. ignition.] 1. The act of igniting, kindling, or setting on fire. [1913 Webster]
2. The state of being ignited or kindled. --Sir T. Browne. [1913 Webster]

ignition n 1: the process of initiating combustion 2: the mechanism that ignites the fuel in an internal-combustion engine [syn: {ignition system}] 3: the act of setting on fire or catching fire [syn: {firing}, {lighting}, {kindling}, {inflammation}]
